keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: A question in oral arguments hinted at a possible path that would not require revision of constitutional standards for discrimination based on sexual orientation.

headline.print_headline: Gender Bias Issue Could Sway Chief Justice
headline.main: Gender Bias Issue Could Tip Chief Justice Roberts Into Ruling for Gay Marriage

snippet: A question in oral arguments hinted at a possible path that would not require revision of constitutional standards for discrimination based on sexual orientation.
abstract: Chief Justice John Roberts Jr, during Supreme Court arguments over same-sex marriage, hints that he may vote in favor of it following rationale that such bans fall under sex discrimination; theory is unlikely to become main reason for overthrowing ban, but could point to path that would not require revision of constitutional standards for discrimination based on sexual orientation.
